body: What's the reason for the bright yellow background?

Thomas Kluyver, on 2014-01-14 10:03,  wrote:

> What's the reason for the bright yellow background?

On hover over the word "toolbar", the toolbar is highlighted, to
visually indicate to the user what is being referred to. I was
going to add this kind of thing to the menu bar, and the notebook
name box.
I see, it's just for specific tutorial notebooks.
shoudln't javascript be disabled at load time ?

Some comments:
- When I wrote the new "User Interface" notebook, I thought about adding something like this. I like this idea and the hover implementation. I think the "User Interface" notebook at this point would be a better place for this though, but that notebook and the one you modified probably need to be cleaned up a bit as the cover some of the same stuff.
- We should get into the habit of putting things like this (JS code) into a cell that has to be run to get the JavaScript to run. People downloading our example notebooks won't have trusted them initially so the JS code won't run on load.
- I think the yellow color is too jarring. It should be something clear but subtle. Maybe a light blue - which is a common color used to high light things in UIs.

> I think the yellow color is too jarring. It should be something clear but subtle. Maybe a light blue - which is a common color used to high light things in UIs.

I completely agree...

Just found this:

http://bootstraptour.com/

It does this type of thing extremely well. Using this we could make a Tour item in the Help menu.

@ivanov what do you think?
@ivanov thoughts on using bootstrap tour for this type of thing?
Hey @ellisonbg - yeah, Bootstrap Tour looks like a great way to go, I've stated working on the tour.
How are you getting bootstrap tour on the page?
OK, I've added bootstrap tour as a `require`ment, one can now start the tour from the Help menu on any notebook

Travis is angry. 
Do you want to use require to load `tour.js` only on demand ?
Oups that was me.... commenting from work ...
Oh... two Matthias... We have enough with @Carreau, let's kick out @mbussonn!!!
needs rebase, too
This looks good to me as-is, but I expect @fperez and @ellisonbg will want to look over the actual content of the tour.

- I think this is great and I like the approach.
- I am -1 on having an automatic timer on things like this. Slow reader/explorers will always get frustrated, and fast ones will click through. I would just have the next/prev/end buttons.
- There are margin/paddings missing between the buttons and the edge of the popups.
- On some browser widths, the popup is unable to point to elements close to the edge. This means they point to the wrong place.
- When the popups are over the kernel/mode notifications, they actually cover it some of the time and don't show the indicator when the popup says it should.
- Can we also provide steps for the toolbar?

> I am -1 on having an automatic timer on things like this. Slow reader/explorers will always get frustrated, and fast ones will click through. I would just have the next/prev/end buttons.

Ok, done.

> There are margin/paddings missing between the buttons and the edge of the  popups.

Can you give me a screenshot? For me it looks like this.
![2014-02-28-171307_291x195_scrot](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/118211/2300073/ac9ebc84-a0de-11e3-94f3-fdb7296b486d.png)

> On some browser widths, the popup is unable to point to elements close to the edge. This means they point to the wrong place.

I've only seen this when the window isn't wide enough, and I don't think there's much we can do about that. Can you suggest what you have in mind?

> When the popups are over the kernel/mode notifications, they actually cover it some of the time and don't show the indicator when the popup says it should.

This is because we no longer have an element displayed when we are in Command Mode. I'll try to hack around that. Please tell me if there are other examples - I believe I've corrected the rest.

> Can we also provide steps for the toolbar?

I've added a step for the toolbar, and removed the timed transitions
Thanks Paul I will have a look!
looks like I need another rebase...

Great work, and very useful! This is something we should actively promote for users...

Some points that need attention:
- If I go _back_ after having switched from command to edit mode, it still says "you are in command mode", but that's not true (I'm in edit mode). I think you're making the right state transitions when moving forward, but not back.
- "Mode Indicator": I would word it instead of "This indicator tells you which mode you are in." as "In this area, an indicator can appear to tell you which mode you are in". Otherwise, if you get there while in command mode, you read "this indicator" but the arrow is pointing to a blank area, which feels a bit confusing.
- "Mode indicator": in command mode, it should say something like "Right now you are in Command mode, and many keyboard shortcuts are available (In this mode, no icon is displayed in the indicator area)." or similar. We want to tell people that the _absence_ of any icon there signals command mode. Also, the title should be "Command mode", not "mode indicator".
- I'm getting edit mode deactivated when I page through the tour and go to the "notice the border..." part. No idea why, but it's confusing, because I'm getting switched out to command mode.  It was in edit mode in the part before, but when I click 'next', it reads "notice that the border...", but it switches out to command mode, so there's nothing to notice. Confusing...
- The tour dies after the part talking about command mode. It highlights the word 'help' in the menu, and then nothing. Furthermore, after it dies, I can't seem to restart it anymore. Selecting it again from the menu does nothing. The only fix is to do a full page reload.
Final question: is this testable at all?

I'm working on addressing Fernando's comments. The mode confusion stuff came out of the new dual mode fixes which were merged and I rebased on top of, but hadn't had a chance to verify that everything still worked as it should. Now it does.

By the way, @ellisonbg I think I understand what you meant when you talked about padding. Were you talking about having the forward arrow be all the way on the left?

Having contributed to the training of over 250 optometrists, let me put it this way:

Better 1 or 2?

| 1 | 2 |
| --- | :-: |
| ![1](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/118211/2300073/ac9ebc84-a0de-11e3-94f3-fdb7296b486d.png) | ![2014-03-01-002813_305x193_scrot](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/118211/2301048/6c268af0-a120-11e3-81ab-ec9104bd95e0.png) |

Ok, I've made it work with the new dual mode fixes. As far as testing - I think it wouldn't be worth the effort at this point. We will likely have to tweak the tour for the next major release, since UI element selectors might change. This isn't crucial functionality for the "living off of master" types, I view this as docs more than testable functionality.

@ivanov, agreed on the testing. It was just curiosity.

Thanks for addressing the feedback, this is looking very good.

Much improved! A few more comments: General comments: - When I click next or previous, there is a jump in the popup. - The text in each step should be written in complete sentences. - The borders for the next/prev buttons are still off (missing): ![screen shot 2014-03-03 at 12 07 00 pm](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/27600/2314045/e5fba2b0-a310-11e3-8380-9c0660268ee7.png) Comments on specific popups: Notebook Menubar: Center this horizontally on the screen if possible (like the toolbar one). "The menubar has menus for actions on the notebook, its cells and the kernel it communicates with." Notebook Toolbar: "The toolbar has buttons for the most common actions. Hover your mouse over each button for more information." Mode indicator -> Mode Indicator Command Mode: If, possible, the "Mode Indicator" and "Command Mode" popups should be at the same vertical level as the first "Edit Mode" one. Right now it still looks like the first two are covering up something. ![screen shot 2014-03-03 at 12 13 31 pm](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/27600/2314058/0fa880f6-a311-11e3-906c-bb0d8881828d.png) Edit Mode: Combine the two into one: "Notice that the border around the currently active cell changed color. Typing will insert text into the currently active cell." back to Command Mode -> Back To Command Mode Use 
esc
for the keyboard shortcut. They are all lowercase now.
